guilt.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong
guilt.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
I was racked with guilt at my part in making her this unhappy.
Sometimes I felt little pangs of guilt.
Don’t you have any feelings of guilt about leaving David?
guilt.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the fact that you have broken an official law or moral rule
guilt.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He did not deny his guilt.
guilt.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: responsibility and blame for something bad that has happened
guilt.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Guilt for poorly behaved children usually lies with the parents.
guilt.translation[0].note_box[0].section: I had a lot of guilt about what had happened.
She didn’t feel any guilt; she had done nothing wrong.
be consumed with/racked with/overwhelmed by guilt
Later he was horrified that he had hit her, and was racked by guilt.
She died before I got there, and there was nothing I could do to assuage my guilt and regret.
I had a permanent feeling of guilt that I didn't see Mum and Dad as often as I should.
Richard felt a pang of guilt, knowing that he had forgotten her birthday.
Many children feel a burden of guilt when their parents divorce, believing that they have caused the separation.
Some of the survivors developed a guilt complex. Why had they lived when others had died?
Should we feel some kind of collective guilt for what happened in the past?
guilt.translation[0].note_box[1].section: guilt
the feeling you have when you have done something you know is wrong
Divorce often leaves people with feelings of guilt.
shame
the feeling of being guilty or embarrassed that you have after doing something that is wrong, when you feel you have lost people’s respect
I was too scared to help him, and I was filled with shame.
regret
a feeling of sadness about something, especially because you wish it had not happened
Kate watched her go with a pang of regret.
remorse
a strong feeling of being sorry for doing something very bad
a murderer who showed no remorse
contrition
a feeling of being guilty and sorry for something wrong that you have done
The company CEO expressed contrition for the errors that led to the crash.
He sounded full of contrition.
They wanted to perform some kind of act of contrition (=do something that shows you feel sorry for something ).
penitence
a feeling of being sorry for something that you have done wrong, when you do not intend to do it again
He expressed genuine penitence at the harm he had done her.
a period of reflection and penitence
conscience
the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong
My conscience has been troubling me ever since.
